1.0.name: wordpress/wp-github-tools
1.0.description:
Use the custom GitHub Commit widget to display a list of the latest updates from a repository. Additionally, you can use shortcodes to add commit lists or embed any gist. The plugin will cache the GitHub response for a certain time period (default: 1 day). You can change this value to half a day or 1 hour. To get more time frames you will need an additional plugin that extends the cron schedules.

Shortcodes

[gist id='gist_id' ]

Embeds a gist in your post. Parameters:

  • id (required) The id of the gist you want to embed.

[commits repository='your-repository' count='max-count' title='your-title']

Displays the latest commits from your repository. Parameters:

  • repository (required) The name of the repository you wish to get.
  • count (optional) The number of commits to retrieve (order by date). Default: 5
